sub_topic: Determining the treewidth of a graph.
message_1:
What is the treewidth of a complete graph K5?
(Note: A complete graph K5 has five vertices and each vertex is connected to every other vertex.)
message_2:
The treewidth of a complete graph K5 is 4.

In general, the treewidth of a complete graph Kn is n-1. This is because a tree decomposition of a complete graph can be formed by creating a bag for each vertex and including all its neighbors in the bag. Since each vertex in a complete graph has n-1 neighbors, the treewidth is n-1.
